head.title: Camera in an Iowa Field Watches the Corn Grow

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Technology, Telecommunications and Internet

hedline.hl1: Camera in an Iowa Field Watches the Corn Grow

abstract.p: Web surfers can watch corn as it grows on an Iowa farm via CornCam, Internet site that presents fresh images every 15 minutes from cornfield near Prairieburg, Iowa; photo (S)

block.p: It has been said that on a hot July day in a Midwestern cornfield, you can hear the corn growing. Whether or not that is true, Web surfers can watch corn as it grows on an Iowa farm.

CornCam presents fresh images every 15 minutes from a cornfield near Prairieburg, Iowa (www.IowaFarmer.com/corncam /corn.html). Viewers can check regularly to see how much the crop has grown since it was planted in late April. (It is not quite as high as an elephant's eye.)
It has been said that on a hot July day in a Midwestern cornfield, you can hear the corn growing. Whether or not that is true, Web surfers can watch corn as it grows on an Iowa farm.

CornCam presents fresh images every 15 minutes from a cornfield near Prairieburg, Iowa (www.IowaFarmer.com/corncam /corn.html). Viewers can check regularly to see how much the crop has grown since it was planted in late April. (It is not quite as high as an elephant's eye.)

The site includes information about the field (it was planted on April 30 without tilling, a method that conserves soil) and links to many other corn sites, including one dedicated to the Corn Palace in Mitchell, S.D.
CornCam is operated by Iowa Farmer Today, a weekly newspaper, which is seeking sponsors for a SoyBeanCam.
No word on whether a PaintDryCam is in the works.
